image.altText: Postkarte zur Bauhaus-Ausstellung by Ludwig Hirschfeld-Mack, c. 1923

props.synopsis: The National Gallery of Australia's newest major exhibition, Cézanne to Giacometti, traces the roots of Australian modernism to European artists fleeing the Second World War.

title.children: These Jewish artists fled Germany in WWII — and took an aesthetic revolution with them

image.altText: The ACT Supreme Court towards dusk.

props.synopsis: Former AFL umpire coach, 70-year-old Michael Rigo, is sentenced to prison for indecently assaulting a 16-year-old Canberra boy on four occasions after training sessions in the 1980s.

title.children: Former AFL umpire coach jailed for sexually abusing 16-year-old in 1980s

image.altText: A moody shot of Parliament House through trees.

props.synopsis: The agency tasked with policing corruption failed to follow its own rules — wrongly dismissing a complaint about one of its commissioners and breaching a legal duty to report such matters to its oversight body.

title.children: National corruption watchdog mishandled complaint against commissioner

image.altText: A woman sitting behind a microphone in the ABC studio.

props.synopsis: Australian National University Vice-Chancellor Genevieve Bell confirms an external investigator will review allegations of "wildly inappropriate behaviour" within the College of Health and Medicine.

title.children: ANU open to firing staff over 'wildly inappropriate behaviour'

image.altText: A man standing in a room looks to his side, with a serious and focused expression. Part of his face and the room is in shadow.

props.synopsis: Former military lawyer David McBride has lost his appeal against the severity of his sentence for sharing classified documents with journalists.

title.children: Jailed whistleblower David McBride loses appeal against sentence

image.altText: The exterior of a modern building made from concrete and glass that reads "John Curtin School of Medical Research" on the side.

props.synopsis: A damning independent review into gender and cultural issues at the Australian National University's College of Health and Medicine reveals a "dysfunctional culture" of bullying, sexism, unfair workloads and nepotism.

title.children: Damning review reveals 'dehumanising' culture at ANU college

image.altText: An ice rink surrounded by black chairs.

props.synopsis: The Australian Instutitute of Sport transforms a basketball court into an ice rink for the Canberra Brave. The rink is the first in the league to have full bowl seating.

title.children: Canberra Brave transforms AIS basketball court into ice hockey rink

image.altText: Isabelle Kelly of the Blues never ground the ball

props.synopsis: The Queensland Maroons face an uphill battle to avoid the first 3-0 sweep in Women's State of Origin history, taking on a rampant NSW Blues side in the third game in Newcastle. Follow live.

title.children: Kelly commits all-time howler by grounding ball on her arm

image.altText: Andrew Dillon and Laura Kane sitting next to each other lisetning to an adress in a press conference

props.synopsis: Laura Kane's job as head of AFL football operations will be split into two roles amid widespread executive changes at league headquarters.

title.children: Months of drama lead to major changes within the AFL

image.altText: Sam Durham limps as he is helped from the ground

props.synopsis: After an impressive win at the MCG against Hawthorn, reigning premier Brisbane returns home to take on an injury-hit and under-fire Essendon side at the Gabba. Follow live.

title.children: Depleted Bombers face another injury scare as Lions take control

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: AFLW star steps away from footy

image.altText: Matildas Interim Head Coach, Tom Sermanni on the sideline, watching a match intently, standing in a tracksuit

props.synopsis: Interim Matildas coach Tom Sermanni delivers a scathing critique of the A-League Women competition's professionalism, stating that Australian football remains "grossly underinvested" in the women's game.

title.children: Matildas coach unloads both barrels on A-League Women

image.altText: A smiling, middle-aged man in a dark suit poses for a corporate-style headshot.

props.synopsis: A South Australian councillor says he will appeal to the ombudsman after colleagues called on him to quit his position for refusing to acknowledge Welcome to Country ceremonies.

title.children: Councillor refuses to resign after Welcome to Country snub

image.altText: A headshot of James Bailie.

props.synopsis: Harvard University's Australian students' group chat is often focused on picnics and pub nights. But it's now blowing up with talk about the Trump administration's sudden move to end their enrolment.

title.children: Australians in limbo as Trump says Harvard's 'getting their ass kicked'

image.altText: A man takes a selfie at an outdoor bar

props.synopsis: It may take authorities up to 60 days to charge Australian Lamar Aaron Ahchee for his alleged connection to the smuggling of 1.8 kilograms of drugs into Indonesia.

title.children: Aussie faces 60-day wait as Bali police gather drug smuggling evidence

image.altText: A man with a dark beard wearing a checked shirt sitting in the front passenger seat of a car alongside another man.

props.synopsis: Mohammad Sinwar — who Israel's military says leads Hamas's paramilitary wing and was once tipped to become the group's next commander — is dead, the Israeli prime minister says.

title.children: Netanyahu says a key Hamas leader is dead. It may reshape the Gaza war

image.altText: Ryan Crowley playing football for Essendon.

props.synopsis: Former Fremantle player Ryan Crowley faces court in Perth charged with choking a woman, deprivation of liberty and other violent offences.

title.children: Ex-Docker Ryan Crowley faces court accused of choking, assaulting woman in Perth

image.altText: Anthony Albanese pointing at press conference

props.synopsis: The prime minister has lashed out at one of the country's leading security think tanks and demanded it "have a look at themselves" after it warned Australia could be left with a "brittle and hollowed defence force" if military funding was not increased.

title.children: PM tells think tank to 'have a look at themselves' after defence report

image.altText: A composit image of an aerial of a flooded landscape and an image of dry landcape with a lone tree.

props.synopsis: There are signs a major climate driver could shift into its "wet phase" over the coming months, boosting the chance of rain across large parts of Australia toward the end of winter.

title.children: BOM's winter outlook gives clues as to whether rain will fall where it's needed

image.altText: Several people standing in a line and holding a large Russian flag.

props.synopsis: Vladamir Putin's forces took control of the Ukrainian city of Mariupol three years ago. For the residents who didn't flee, life there has changed significantly, but speaking out can be deadly.

title.children: After Russia captured this city, its new rulers started taking houses

image.altText: Jade Young, 47, was fatally stabbed at Westfield Bondi Junction on Saturday, April 13, 2024

props.synopsis: The mother of Jade Young, who was killed in the Westfield Bondi Junction stabbing, says she thinks some people who have appeared at the coronial inquest "have lost [the] fact that six much-loved people are dead, murdered".

title.children: Loved ones of Bondi stabbing victim 'hurt so terribly' after loss

image.altText: Two men wearing suits shake hands in front of the Tongan and Chinese flags.

props.synopsis: Pacific Island nations supported China's claim over Taiwan in a meeting of foreign ministers, but one expert says Beijing would have hoped for more.

title.children: China swipes at Trump climate policy after Pacific Islands meeting

image.altText: Ashen debris and shards of a plane seen dotting the ground in a circle

props.synopsis: Rescuers were dispatched after receiving reports from residents that an unidentified aircraft crashed on a hill and sparked a fire, a Pohang emergency office said.

title.children: South Korean navy plane crash kills four crew members

image.altText: Children wearing yellow gurnseys smiling and hugging each other

props.synopsis: Most nights in Leonora are filled with the sound of basketballs hitting the concrete. It's the sound of a small outback town coming back from difficult times.

title.children: After a spate of youth suicides in Leonora, 'Pop' returned to make a change

image.altText: A man wearing a dark shirt stands outside a courthouse

props.synopsis: A charge of using a Nazi symbol has been dropped against National Socialist Network leader Thomas Sewell.

title.children: Charges dropped for Nazi symbol use at Australia Day gathering

image.altText: A surveillance image of a man carrying a TV into a shop

props.synopsis: A man who murdered his elderly mother with a 15kg pot plant before selling her belongings for drug money has been jailed for at least 21 years.

title.children: Man who murdered elderly mum with pot plant sentenced to 21 years jail

image.altText: Two law enforcement officers and a man with a digitally blurred face walk through an airport.

props.synopsis: Craig Anthony Dwyer, who was extradited from Canberra, is jailed for the violent rape of a 19-year-old in 1993 after he broke into her university accommodation.

title.children: Man jailed for 1993 rape of university student after DNA match breakthrough

image.altText: A drawing of a boy sitting down in court

props.synopsis: The chair of a parliamentary inquiry into youth crime says there are virtually no services available to young people after dark, while the cost of detaining a young offender soars past $1 million.

title.children: Youth crime probe finds 'tough' approach will not work

image.altText: A pedestal fan blows on a clothes drying rack with clothes hanging on it.

props.synopsis: Simple, effective ways to dry laundry indoors when it’s wet outside and you don’t have access to a dryer.

title.children: How to dry laundry without a dryer when it's cold or wet outside

image.altText: An Instagram post confirming that Manawa Aranui had re-signed with a netball team in Victoria.

props.synopsis: A netballer has hit back at an opposition club after being deemed ineligible to play for the rest of the season due to their superior "stamina and physique".

title.children: Gender-diverse netballer removed from country leagues

image.altText: A residential Melbourne street with a row of parked cars.

props.synopsis: If you want to tackle your parking problems, here are some things to consider.

title.children: What are the rules when parking on a suburban street?

image.altText: Giant metal pipes form part of the Karratha gas plant, with two workers dwarfed by its size.

props.synopsis: The prime minister says gas is needed in the transition to net zero by 2050 — but the government's critics say granting approval to Woodside's North West Shelf to operate until 2070 threatens that 2050 commitment.

title.children: PM defends extension of Australia's largest gas project to 2070

image.altText: Officers walk along Back Beach during the search for a man missing off Bunbury

props.synopsis: Police say David Taylor was last seen going for a dawn swim at Bunbury's Back Beach at about 5 o'clock, as part of his regular morning routine.

title.children: Search underway for 70yo swimmer missing off southern WA coast

image.altText: A rooftop among mud

props.synopsis: A large part of a glacier in the Swiss Alps has broken away, bringing down mud and rock onto a nearby village.

title.children: Rockslide buries Swiss Alps village
